page.title: 03ST.MARGARETS FM.GREEN ST.GRN
page.content: This farm is named after a chapel that was demolished about 80 years ago, sited nearby. The farm land is between 25 and 60 metres above sea level, and is a light, chalky, well drained soil. Cereals, potatoes, brassicas, peas, pears and apples are being grown in 1985 on 1000 acres. This produce is taken by lorries through Dartford Tunnel to an Essex distribution centre which delivers it to supermarkets as required. 130 young steers are bought and kept in sheds, fattened on silage, maize and vegetable waste and sold later at Ashford meat market. On this farm are large public warehouses and cold stores where dry and frozen food is kept until it is sold. The farm workforce, made up of about 25 local men and women, is supplemented by 40 women for the fruit and potato harvest
